intro: Astragalus anserinifolius var. elegantifolius, commonly known as the elegant leaf milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves with pinnate arrangement. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in dryland gardens.
